alert.note: Alert for Fentress; Overton; Pickett (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 20 at 12:04PM CDT until July 20 at 3:15PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Western Fentress County in middle Tennessee... Central Overton County in middle Tennessee... Southwestern Pickett County in middle Tennessee... * Until 315 PM CDT. * At 1204 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 5 and 7 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring with numerous reports received of flooded and washed-out roads. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Livingston, Jamestown, Allardt, Crawford, Grimsley and Clarkrange. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
